channel.title: CVE Feed for Rockwell Automation -- Arena Simulation
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Rockwell Automation -- Arena Simulation

item.title: CVE-2024-2929|2024-08-01T19:32:41.647Z -- rockwell%20automation -- arena%20simulation
item.description: A memory corruption vulnerability in Rockwell Automation Arena Simulation software could potentially allow a malicious user to insert unauthorized code to the software by corrupting the memory triggering an access violation. Once inside, the threat actor can run harmful code on the system. This affects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the product. To trigger this, the user would unwittingly need to open a malicious file shared by the threat actor.

item.title: CVE-2024-2929|2024-03-26T15:56:31.967Z -- rockwell%20automation -- arena%20simulation
item.description: A memory corruption vulnerability in Rockwell Automation Arena Simulation software could potentially allow a malicious user to insert unauthorized code to the software by corrupting the memory triggering an access violation. Once inside, the threat actor can run harmful code on the system. This affects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the product. To trigger this, the user would unwittingly need to open a malicious file shared by the threat actor.

item.title: CVE-2024-21912|2024-03-26T15:34:35.837Z -- rockwell%20automation -- arena%20simulation
item.description: An arbitrary code execution vulnerability in Rockwell Automation Arena Simulation could let a malicious user insert unauthorized code into the software. This is done by writing beyond the designated memory area, which causes an access violation. Once inside, the threat actor can run harmful code on the system. This affects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the product. To trigger this, the user would unwittingly need to open a malicious file shared by the threat actor.

item.title: CVE-2024-21913|2024-03-26T15:38:23.962Z -- rockwell%20automation -- arena%20simulation
item.description: A heap-based memory buffer overflow vulnerability in Rockwell Automation Arena Simulation software could potentially allow a malicious user to insert unauthorized code into the software by overstepping the memory boundaries, which triggers an access violation. Once inside, the threat actor can run harmful code on the system. This affects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the product. To trigger this, the user would unwittingly need to open a malicious file shared by the threat actor.

item.title: CVE-2024-21918|2024-03-26T15:44:33.835Z -- rockwell%20automation -- arena%20simulation
item.description: A memory buffer vulnerability in Rockwell Automation Arena Simulation software could potentially allow a malicious user to insert unauthorized code to the software by corrupting the memory and triggering an access violation. Once inside, the threat actor can run harmful code on the system. This affects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the product. To trigger this, the user would unwittingly need to open a malicious file shared by the threat actor.

item.title: CVE-2024-21919|2024-03-26T15:46:38.129Z -- rockwell%20automation -- arena%20simulation
item.description: An uninitialized pointer in Rockwell Automation Arena Simulation software could potentially allow a malicious user to insert unauthorized code to the software by leveraging the pointer after it is properly. Once inside, the threat actor can run harmful code on the system. This affects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the product. To trigger this, the user would unwittingly need to open a malicious file shared by the threat actor.

item.title: CVE-2024-21920|2024-03-26T15:48:59.735Z -- rockwell%20automation -- arena%20simulation
item.description: A memory buffer vulnerability in Rockwell Automation Arena Simulation could potentially let a threat actor read beyond the intended memory boundaries. This could reveal sensitive information and even cause the application to crash, resulting in a denial-of-service condition. To trigger this, the user would unwittingly need to open a malicious file shared by the threat actor.
